attributes.action: make it a legal requirement to inform UK phone callers the cost of phone calls
attributes.background: The cost of phone calls from a mobile phone or landline should be regulated so that prior to connection a prerecorded message should make the charge per minute clear to the caller and all Utility companies and Charities for the low paid and vulnerable should have available freephone contact numbers
attributes.additional_details: Offcom really need to put their house in order they have consistently failed to inform the public about how much money they are paying for phone calls especially on 'pay as you go'. Some phone numbers in the UK which are regularly used by those on low incomes and those on benefits are being charged at exorbitant rates which they can ill afford. Im sue many of these people end up not making  calls because of the cost and end up being penalised for not informing a company or government department

attributes.action: Better treatment for NHS dialysis patients
attributes.background:
Government figures. I If a patient enters dialysis after the age of 
70to 75 life expectancy is 1 to 2 years. I entered at the age of 82 I am now in my 7th year.
attributes.additional_details:
Kidney failure
This petition could apply to any person of any age. 
I never had kidney failure, I had two operations 12 years apart each operation killed one kidney. 	 
I diagnosed myself and informed the doctor in writing more than a dozen times when I had a closure of an artery,  
There is a system for detecting closures it’s called a transonic flow meter it is used on patients once every three months? 
My petition is for the flow meter to be used on the patient four times a month with a minimum of twice a month.
It will mean patients living longer but that is what nursing is all about? 
Please sign this petition, you will be helping others and by unfortunate chance you might be helping your self.

attributes.action: Set up a single tribunal service for all public services complaints/ grievances.
attributes.background: Call on the government to create a fair free tribunal body and procedure to hear complaints/grievances/appeals relating to failure, mistakes or misuse of power by those in all public services who conceal their wrongdoing.
attributes.additional_details:
The impact to people affected is simply being normalised and accepted as the way things are.

The public must have a right to a fair tribunal service & charter which allows their concerns to be heard when they have suffered failure/mistakes & gives the tribunal more powers to compel witnesses/public officers to testify. The public’s rights matter & they must be entitled to free access to justice & due process in disputes before an impartial judge as those in public office can use public money to conceal failure/mistakes & those affected have no voice & most cannot access legal assistance.

attributes.action: Make Michaelmas Day (29th September) a public holiday.
attributes.background:
Michaelmas (Mickle-mas) was The Feast of St Michael and was used to celebrate the final harvest.  Everything that couldn't be preserved was eaten in a great feast.

This holiday would be a dress rehearsal for Christmas, minus the relatives and presents!

attributes.action: Require fire evacuation and lockdown drills in UK schools and colleges
attributes.background: I am very interested in health and safety and I want to feel like I make a difference to this country by making our schools and colleges a safer environment for staff and students by carrying out fire evacuations termly and a lockdown procedure test at least once a year.

attributes.action: Income Tax changes to be more diverse either individual or per house hold
attributes.background: Currently income tax works on an individual basis, therefore if a household has two workers at 35k they both pay 20% tax each, however in a family with children only one adult works they are penalised after 46k,
attributes.additional_details:
Council tax and other taxes work on the basis of per house hold so why not for Income Tax, changing this to a per household rate allowing partners to absorb/ utilise the tax allowance prior to the increase to 40% and/or 50%. 

Example could be: Adult 1 salary 20k, Adult 2 salary 60k tax would only increase to 40% once 80k mark has hit, this would aide families where only one parent is working and/ or coupled adults living under a single roof

attributes.action: Require all dog breeders to keep a correct record of Dogs chipped and sold on.
attributes.background: Today 5 Dogs caught as strays....have a chip no. but either not registered or no longer a current contact.

attributes.action: Add Middle Rate Mobility for children receiving Disability Living Allowance
attributes.background:
My 10 year daughter has hyper mobility type Ehlers Danlos Syndrome, she has low muscle tone, subluxations of joints, swelling of joints, widespread joint pain to name a few symptoms. 
She has ankle braces, insoles, a wheelchair and other aids to help but she has never been entitled to mobility.
attributes.additional_details:
There is 3 rates of care but only 2 for mobility and the criterias for 2 rates don’t accomadate for children like my daughter. 
For LRM the criteria is the child needs ‘guidance or supervision with walking on unfamiliar routes’ and for HRM the criteria is the child must be unable to walk, virtually unable to walk, have no legs or feet, be SMI, be SVI, be blind and deaf or be a danger to them self. There should be an in between for children who have days where they need a wheelchair etc.

attributes.action: Require schools to sell logos to sew on to uniforms
attributes.background: Uniform costs are rising and parents are having to worry about meeting these costs. If schools were made to sell their logos to sew onto cheaper alternatives this would alleviate a massive burden. Instead of paying £50 for a blazer cheaper ones are available at a fraction of the cost etc.

attributes.action: Scrap the CQC as an onerous bombastic regulation lead organisation
attributes.background: The CQC and its predecessors have developed this watch dog role since 2004, and it’s worth asking what if anything, these state appointed monitors have contributed to health and social care during that time, apart from undermining leadership and interrupting health care delivery.
attributes.additional_details: I believe the CQC have made clear mistakes over recent years. It is clear that they are unlikely to change their methodology and a majority of health care professionals across the country think they are not fit for purpose, and wish to see a change in the way health and social care is regulated.

attributes.action: Impose a 3 to 5% sales tax for online every day retail purchases- exc food, hols
attributes.background: Town centres are the beating heart of the community in Britain. As well as the environmental impact of ordering everything online, trying it on, sending it back etc big dominant US retailers take money out of the UK with unfair tax dodges. Let's boost the high street, or chancery coffers, with e-VAT

attributes.action: Stop the state pension reducing tax allowances for working pensioners
attributes.background: Many people remain in work beyond retirement age training the next generation. Some work because they need to top up their income rather than turn to the state for benefits. Decreasing tax codes re-taxes PAYBACK of money already paid in tax. This was not an investment but saving.
attributes.additional_details: What the government should do is change the law so the state pension doesn't count towards someone's personal tax allowance if they are working. Having completed one working career paying for that pension, the government should allow people to continue to work without having their tax code reduced. This double tax on pensions puts people off continuing to contribute to society. The well being of remaining part time in work reduces a burden on the state. State pension is a PAYBACK and not an additional income!

attributes.action: Alter "laws" that bar certain Brits from jobs with the Secret Service.
attributes.background: The Home Office, FCO, MI5,MI6,HMGCC & other Gov’ Offices reject applicants simply because they don’t have a British Parent with British ties; even if they have a Naturalization Certificate and a British Passport. That these documents do “NOT” make one British enough to be appointed is unacceptable!
attributes.additional_details: Evidence is the Criterium openly set out as advertised on the Foreign Offices’ websites and MI5, MI6, also enshrined in UK Law.

attributes.action: Ban the selling and open displaying of Golliwog dolls in UK stores.
attributes.background: Golliwog dolls depict a racially insulting charactater of black people. This is no longer acceptable. Sign the petition and let the goverment know, how the UK really feels about the legal selling and displaying of Golliwog dolls.
attributes.additional_details:
The Golliwog character has long been used in childrens literature, to denigrate black people. The use of the racial word "wog" originates from this ignorant depiction of black people.

It's time for all people to make clear that the selling of these racially provocative dolls, needs to stop.

The displaying of such dolls on store front windows, has to stop.

Share and sign this petition.

attributes.action: I want disability education to become a mandatory lesson in all schools.
attributes.background: I suffer with cerebral palsy as a result of complications during birth and having witnessed several incidents in which people are subject to abuse because they seem like normal people but they have to use a wheelchair for certain situations.

attributes.action: Put a limit on the amount of homework students can be given in a week.
attributes.background: The reason to this is that the amount of homework given to students at the moment is reducing time that could be spent on something productive such as clubs. Also a lot of people spend more time on homework than they would outside in their own time.

attributes.action: Ensure parliamentary privilege does not apply to deliberate misrepresentation.
attributes.background: In instances where MPs uttered comments about an individual which in a public place, rather than parliament, could lead to slander or libel charges because they were a deliberate misrepresentation, then parliamentary privilege should not apply.
attributes.additional_details: Our MP's should be held to the highest standards in public life, however they should not be permitted to make comments in the Houses of Parliament which if they were made in a public domain could lead them open the charges of slander or libel. Parliamentary privilege should not apply to deliberate misrepresentation and if a member of the public were to be misrepresented they should have the right to challenge this in a court of law, or within Parliament itself.

attributes.action: Now facts are known, allow the public to vote between no deal or remaining in EU
attributes.background: The government can not agree on a brexit agreement with the EU, and now full facts on what a No deal brexit means, the public should be allowed to make an informed vote on remaining in the EU or having a no deal Brexit

attributes.action: Increase the minimum annual leave entitlement from 5.6 weeks to 7.6 weeks.
attributes.background:
The increasing retirement age leaves far less to look forward to at the end of our working lives. We are asking for increased minimum annual leave entitlements during our working lives to compensate for this loss.

This will give us more time with our families and to follow our own interests.
attributes.additional_details:
Retirement age is increasing (currently 67). Estimates are that when today's teenagers retire, the retirement age will be 75. People currently look forward to retirement but with increasing age there are fewer possibilities for those years.

Give us extra leave during our working years so that we can feel that we have lives and interests beyond work. It will reduce stress and exhaustion as well as increase happiness.

We will benefit, our children will benefit, our employers will benefit.

attributes.action: Allow towns to sack county police force and form a town or city force if failed
attributes.background: County police forces do not spread resources correctly and need more police on our streets. Allow constituencies to hold a town vote on whether their police force is better handled by the county or locally in your town or city. Funding from council tax budget which is paid to county force will fund.
attributes.additional_details: Sussex police have failed to tackle many crimes in our area and hardly see a police presence on a day to day basis, youth crime, vehicle crime and public disorder is at a all time high in Arun. Chief Constable York has failed our town. The people deserve this responsibility to have their lives and well being protected.

attributes.action: Lower the cost of university tuition fees.
attributes.background: We are starting to view universities that look great to us with the subjects we want to study but the tuition fees are a big factor and we’ve realised that they shouldn’t cost £9,250 so help us lower this and help more people attend university.

attributes.action: Stop the Tampon Tax
attributes.background: The tampon tax should be scrapped completely, or at the least reduced. This is something natural that women go through and shouldn’t be used to the government’s advantage.

attributes.action: Maintenance payments (inc Spousal) as an attachment of Earnings or via Court
attributes.background: When maintenance is not paid after a Court has ordered it it is wrong to have to keep going back to Court to enforce. Apart from the trauma that you go through for years in my case, and the cost which ran into thousands, why should you have to wait and fight again after an order is made
attributes.additional_details:
It is also a fact that the time it takes to enforce can put that person into even more debt, or the chance to lose their home when maintenance isn’t paid.
It is obvious the person isn’t going to want to pay, which is why it ends up in Court, so why is this not taken as an attachment of earnings or via Court within the order?
The system doesn’t allow for both parties to get on with their lives as it states is the purpose when the one side is always unsure of receiving what was fought for

attributes.action: Save Britain's Motorways from terrible driving with regular reminders.
attributes.background: Britain's Motorways are congested, but this isn't helped by terrible drivers. Slow driving and lane hogging can be worse than speeding. Speeding is policed with signs and fines. Do the same and regularly remind drivers on digital displays and bridges to speed up or keep left. Simple but effective.
attributes.additional_details:
https://metro.co.uk/2018/12/29/crashes-caused-drivers-going-slow-soar-third-8290610/

Personal experience of driving on Britain's roads.

attributes.action: M1 motorway must go beyond Berwick upon Tweed
attributes.background: As we now have the M6 motorway on the west coast, going all the way up to the Anglo-Scottish border (i.e. Gretna Green) and then connecting the M74 motorway on the other side of the border, we could now do with having a motorway that goes over the border on the east coast too.
attributes.additional_details: That's why I urge the government to extend the M1 up to Scotland on the east coast as well.  It would mean people travelling from London to Edinburgh or vice-versa would be able to travel not only quicker, but would also reduce traffic on our roads.

attributes.action: Revive the Black Arrow rocket program to put the UK back into space.
attributes.background: From 1969-71, the UK launched a rocket named Black Arrow. The program was a success, but was unfortunately cancelled due to cost issues. Now with new technology and cheaper launch costs, it would be great to see this program revived to provide an alternative launch platform for sattelite companies.
attributes.additional_details: The Black Arrow saw four launches, with one placing the sattelite Prospero into an orbit around the earth. While the rocket saw two launch failures, it eventually ended up succeeding. Unfortunately, the program was cancelled in favour of using the cheaper US rockets to launch sattelites. With the growth of the space industry, and the advent of Brexit, a UK space program is needed. An updated version of Black Arrow will provide a cheaper alternative to the Ariane or Proton rockets used by Europe.

attributes.action: Enable the means to choose whether internet linked activities can be recorded.
attributes.background: I wish a simple, obvious setting to be shown on all devices used to connect to the internet to enable or prevent the harvesting of all data generated from any use of the internet unless required by law. It should be readily accessible to be turned on or off and take immediate effect.
attributes.additional_details: When Google updated it's Terms of Service, I checked what Google had recorded. It had recorded every search I had performed. Worse, the companies I had searched within, sent that data to Google. E.G. if within another company's web-site you click on a Google map, details go to Google. It goes much further. If I use my Android smart phone to take a picture, the software notifies Google! Anything Android processes goes to Google, payments, hotel bookings etc, they get to know everything - why?

attributes.action: Make the sale age of Tobacco 21
attributes.background:
Increasing the sale age to 21 would decrease the use of tobacco nationwide. 

But ultimately the main goal is to be the first country to ban the sale altogether.
attributes.additional_details:
Alongside increasing the sale age to 21 this would decrease the use of tobacco use,  making steps towards the ultimate goal of banning the sale of tobacco altogether, the UK would make the first country to band the sale of a Dangerous cancer killing drug 

The idea that everyone knows how much it kills is the strangest part about it and as a country we need to me the first move.

attributes.action: Update food allergies laws to list allergens on menus in food establishments
attributes.background: In 2014, food allergies laws were passed for food establishments to tell customers if their food contains ingredients known to trigger allergies. It has recently become apparent staff don't always provide the correct information. An update is needed to make it compulsory for the info to be on menus

attributes.action: Nationalise UK mobile telephone masts.
attributes.background: 6 December 2018, O2 experienced a widespread failure affecting 20m+ UK customers. However other network providers continued to enjoy access. This petition would bring into public hands the network of phone masts, thus guaranteeing equality of access for customers.
attributes.additional_details:
Mobile data access is a key part of working and personal life for almost all people in the UK today. 

To have access for some and not for others when a network goes down is depriving large segments of the population with the ability to be productive, happy, and even safe.

It does not need to be this way, if the hardware of UK mobile data coverage was recognised as a natural monopoly and brought into public hands so it could also be managed in the public interest, all would be better off.

attributes.action: Change student loan arrangements to reflect career success
attributes.background:
The current arrangements reduce the incentive for students to achieve high-earning roles. Successful students see their debt increase every year until they are earning 4 x the average salary. 
Lower earners may never repay anything. This situation cannot be justified.
attributes.additional_details: The interest on the debt should be fixed at the no more than half a percent above the Bank of England rate when the loan is issued. Repayment should then be taken from all earnings/income (with no lower limit) at a rate that would pay the interest charges and reduce the outstanding balance. If students never work then the loan should be collected by a small reduction in any benefits.

attributes.action: Raise awareness of possible depo provera injection side effects
attributes.background: Depo provera injection for birth control and to stop periods I chose this was right treatment for myself only to of met my partner and us decide we want to try for a baby well as we looked deeply on the internet to see what side effects I would well what we found out was really bad and shocking.
attributes.additional_details: The mood swings, irregular periods, and potentially getting bone loss density which some women have through this the reading just shocked me if I had done more research 4+ years ago I would of never of had it. I think this injection should come with a warning label or taken off the market our nurses and doctors just don't know enough and should be well trained in this.

attributes.action: Require unused hospital and pharmacy prescriptions to be reused, not thrown out
attributes.background: My client was a pharmacist in a UK hospital. All prescriptions that were not collected from patients are put in the bin if not collected and not reused. this is a complete waste of money. They are not opened and not used we need to stop this.

attributes.action: Allow 3 wheeled vehicles to be driven on a car licence at 17
attributes.background: In 2013 the law was changed so that 3 wheeled vehicles could not be driven on any licence until the person is 21 i can sort off understand this for motorcycle licences but not car licences

attributes.action: Raise the minimum wage for those working between 9pm and 7am to £14 p/h
attributes.background: Workers of late shifts—which have been proven to have detrimental effects on health—are increasingly common, and these workers are being exploited.
attributes.additional_details:
Tesco—who made a £1·6bl profit last quarter—pay staff near minimum wage to work until midnight. Clubs hire 18–21-year-olds at £5.60/h till 5.The real living wage in the U.K. is nearly £10/h: https://bbc.in/2JGrY0b This work is unhealthy and those employed deserve compensation.

Study noting an increase in the risk of an early death amongst night-shift workers: https://www.theguardian.com/sustainable-business/2015/oct/28/night-shift-three-million-workers-health-risks-obesity-cancer-diabetes

Radio 4 on damage to organs and the brain caused by nightwork: https://www.ajpmonline.org/article/S0749-3797(14)00623-0/fulltext

https://www.psych.ox.ac.uk/news/how-can-working-night-shifts-affect-mental-and-physical-health

attributes.action: Make all religious organisations give equal opportunities to men and women
attributes.background: Employment opportunities must be open to all without discrimination by law. The same must apply to all employment offered by religious organizations in Britain. The sex of the applicant must be made irrelevant.

attributes.action: Public investigation into treatment of people with autism/learning difficulties
attributes.background: Call on the government to investigate and reform the law so that the rights of parents, guardians or next of kin of people with autism/learning difficulties cannot be removed. Re: https://news.sky.com/story/40-people-died-in-barbaric-secure-hospitals-the-government-pledged-would-close-11540038
attributes.additional_details: It is in the general public’s best interest an investigation is carried out into the circumstances of the loss of life of people with a profound learning disability or autism who have died while admitted to secure hospitals or care homes over the last 40 yrs. Currently more than 2000 people are in assessment and treatment units with an average stay of more than 5 ½ years when they are supposed to be discharged within 18 months and their families do not have any right in deciding their treatment

attributes.action: Make it illegal for under 16's to have internet access on their mobile phones!
attributes.background: Children exposed to pornography at 9, cyber bullying see evidence link. Teenagers committing suicide because of cyber bullying, outrageous! They need constant supervision with the internet! It is far too dangerous and the safety of our children is the most important. It goes beyond parents control.
attributes.additional_details:
https://foreverymom.com/mom-gold/horror-stories-real-dont-give-children-smartphone-jonathon-van-maren/

I will give my daughter a cell phone when she is in year 6 and practising getting to school on her own ready for high school, but it will not have access to the internet, thats not going to stop other children who do have internet access from showing her inappropriate pictures or posting things about her though is it! For this to stop it needs to be illegal. They do not need internet access!

attributes.action: Make cat calling an illegal act in the UK
attributes.background:
Cat calling refers to the act of shouting harassing and often sexually suggestive, threatening, or derisive comments at someone publicly. 

Surveys have found that 85% of people under 40 years old have taken a different route home to avoid harassment. Cat Calling should not have this power.
attributes.additional_details:
End Violence Against Women Coalition commissioned YouGov to conduct the first national poll on street harassment in 2016. The poll found that 64% of women of all ages have experienced unwanted sexual harassment in public places.

There are laws in the UK which focus on sexual misconduct but none specifically related to catcalling. This is not an impossible task with countries like Portugal, Belgium and France having already implemented such laws.

attributes.action: Fund non-vocational degrees for people over 60
attributes.background: The Government should fund unallocated university places for non-vocational degrees for free, or for substantially reduced fees, to citizens over 60 who can demonstrate that they would be capable of completing their courses at a satisfactory level of attainment.
attributes.additional_details:
To expand on the idea of the U3A approach and to formalise it into a higher level of attainment for those wishing to pursue academic recognition.

To explore the Chinese model of learning available to older citizens in China: 
http://www.chinadaily.com.cn/a/201806/23/WS5b2d4787a3103349141de584.html

attributes.action: Ban body-shaming and bullying in magazines and newspapers
attributes.background: I have seen so many celebrity body-shaming and bullying in magazines and newspapers. Teenagers are reading it. It can affect their state of mental health especially, including using 'photoshop' photos, 'perfect' bodies. This is the only way it'll stop.
attributes.additional_details: Most recent is Stacey Solomon was on front of Now Magazine with headline 'boring' 'desperate' 'cheap' and why fans are sick of her because they saw a couple comments about her continuous positivity on body confidence, and next there was another story about revenge bodies, and it's wrong to do this, and there should be a ban on body-shaming, bullying in magazines, and should focusing on celebrating your body, and be confident in your skin, and what you look like.

attributes.action: Bring in minimum standards for certain camping equipment sold in the UK.
attributes.background: There is a huge amount of camping equipment abandoned at festivals every year which is bad for the environment. Much of the equipment is of a poor standard and inadequate for the British summer leading to many people getting cold and wet to the extent that they need medical help.
attributes.additional_details:
Minimum standards should be -
Tents must have an inner and outer skin and a minimum Hydrostatic Head rating of 3000. (Small play tents can be exempt.)
Any sleeping bag rated as suitable only for temperatures over 5 degrees centigrade should be clearly labelled "UK Indoors Only".
Roll mats must have a minimum thickness when compressed. 
All folding chairs and stools must have their maximum weight clearly displayed in kilogrammes and stones and pounds, in large letters on the sales label.

attributes.action: Require councils to provide lollypop men and women
attributes.background: Stop any councils in England from using the funds for road crossing supervisors (Lollypop men and Women) to save money. The UK Government should provide additional funding for councils if necessary.
attributes.additional_details: Please check out https://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/burton/school-crossing-patrol-staffordshire-cuts-1997550 and ITV central news 13/9/18

attributes.action: Make good facial growth a strategic health priority.
attributes.background: We ask parliament to make good facial growth a strategic health priority, through an early years education programme and through supporting Public Health England to make research, analysis and treatment policy in this area part of their next strategic plan.
attributes.additional_details: More information can be found on www.preventcrookedteeth.com.

attributes.action: Make Mental Health First Aid a compulsory element of teacher training.
attributes.background: I'm Ben, I've set up this petition as part of a teenage mental health awareness campaign started after my brother, Sam West, tragically committed suicide aged 15 in January 2018. Your signature won't bring my brother back, but it could save someone else's life and that's all I want.
attributes.additional_details: Some teachers, who will remain anonymous, have reacted positively to the idea when it was put past them stating that teachers often won't act at all as they don't have the knowledge or confidence to deal with the situation. A compulsory course will provide the confidence to at least approach a student about their mental wellbeing and start working on a solution. This vital next move, which is cheaper than alternatives, can combat the ever-escalating problem which is teenage mental health.

attributes.action: UK to cut ties and impose sanctions on Pakistan until they rerun elections
attributes.background: It has been reported that the recent Pakistani elections were one of the dirtiest and most rigged elections in many years. The media reports that Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz was the main target of election irregularities and rigging across the country.
attributes.additional_details: According to the media, Pakistan Army soldiers were present inside every polling station at the end of the polling before the polling count started they intervened and forced every polling agent to leave the polling premises. Political parties in Pakistan have rejected these rigged polls. Pakistan's Election Commission should conduct free and fair elections.

attributes.action: Create a new tax and use the money to buy food for starving African children
attributes.background: Introduce a new tax and use the money to buy food for starving African children. I propose a small tax on all goods sold in England. The tax money will buy food for starving African children. Food security is very important, because when people have no money or food, eventually wars happen.
attributes.additional_details: Overall, 5.6 million children under age five died in 2016, nearly 15,000 daily. The risk of a child dying before five years of age is highest in Africa - about 8 times higher than in Europe. Eventually if other countries from around the world put a tax on their goods too, this international tax money would help collapsed economies from around the world, so it would be like a world social security ensuring the world to be a safer world to live in for everyone.

attributes.action: Request intervention in Myanmar at the Security Council against genocide
attributes.background: soldiers in Myanmar have committed genocide according to the United Nations . Amnesty International has also found evidence including forensic medical evidence, corroborated witness testimony and satellite imagery of crimes against humanity.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/uk.mobile.reuters.com/article/amp/idUKKCN1GJ167
https://www.amnesty.org/en/latest/news/2018/06/atrocities-against-the-rohingya-how-we-built-the-case-to-implicate-myanmar-military-officials-in-crimes-against-humanity/

attributes.action: Remove home address from UK Driving Licence.
attributes.background: Most people carry their driving licence and house keys together.  Having your home address on the licence is unnecessary as all information will be attached to the licence number.  It's time to end this potentially dangerous practice.

attributes.action: Ban the use of mobile phones in schools
attributes.background: Phones are causing children to soliaze less and less with each other and getting more and more attached to screens during break times and lunch times when they should be talking and playing. We should limit and control the amount of time our children spend on phones, especially at school.
attributes.additional_details: Banning mobile phones at school is the start to children socialising more rather than them being attached to screens all day. Schools should also have a say in this situation and should ban phones from the premises as it is destroying people’s lives by the havoc a small gadget can do
